title: Mycelium pool

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Mycelium pool is found in the northern area of the Mushroom Forest on Fossil Island. It can be used to calcify fossils into enriched bones. Players can find Irene here, who will explain what the pool is used for.

content:
Mycelium pool
Released7 September 2017 (Update)
MembersYes
LocationFossil Island
TeleportsMagic Mushtree
Map

The Mycelium pool is found in the northern area of the Mushroom Forest on Fossil Island. It can be used to calcify fossils into enriched bones. Players can find Irene here, who will explain what the pool is used for.

The pool holds up to 28 fossils, 10 calcite, and 10 pyrophosphite. The fossils can be unidentified or cleaned, however, plant fossils cannot be enriched and will be instantly destroyed if added to the pool. Unidentified large fossils have a chance to be plant fossils, so cleaning those fossils is not recommended if planning to use them at the mycelium pool.

Using the pool[edit | edit source]

Use the hopper to open the Fossil Pool interface and add fossils, calcite, and pyrophosphite. The items can also be selected and used on the hopper, but the current status of contents will be more ambiguous. The process begins when there are at least 3 calcite and 3 pyrophosphite added, however the exact amount of calcite and pyrophosphite required is not completely known. 10 calcite and 10 pyrophosphite should be enough for an inventory of fossils, regardless of tier. 6 calcite and 6 pyrophosphite are needed for 26 small fossils, or for 22 large fossils, 7 calcite and 7 pyrophosphite are needed for 26 medium fossils.

Once the message The pool begins to bubble is in the chat box, the chemical process begins. During this process, bobbing fossils occasionally appear around the pool and they need to be poked back down, otherwise the fossils will dissolve from too much air exposure. If the number of calcite and pyrophosphite drops to 3 during the enrichment process, it will end and more calcite and pyrophosphite must added to the hopper to start the process again.

Using and confirming opening the sluice gate before turning the fossils into enriched bones will delete all the items in the mycelium pool.

Once the process progress bar has emptied, the process is completed, and any unused calcite or pyrophosphite is deleted. Open the sluice gate to move the enriched bones into the rinsing pool to the north, behind the Ancient Shroom, where they can be collected. There must be enough inventory slots to collect all the fossils at one time.

Using the enriched bones[edit | edit source]

A player using enriched bones on the strange machine.

Use the enriched bones on the easternmost strange machine at the House on the Hill for Prayer experience, the experience rates and experience per fossil are shown in the table below. A trip of enriching bones and then using them on the strange machine takes roughly 2 minutes and 30 seconds.

Fossil type Product XP XP/h
Unidentified small fossil Small enriched bone 500 312,000
Unidentified medium fossil Medium enriched bone 1000 624,000
Unidentified large fossil Large enriched bone 1500 936,000
Unidentified rare fossil Rare enriched bone 2500 1,560,000
